3. Fitzroy is a former railway station in Melbourne, Australia, which was opened in 1888 but closed to passenger services in May 1892 due to poor patronage. The line was thereafter used only for goods trains until 1981.

4. Fitzroy Island is an island east of the southern tip of Stonington Island, lying in Neny Bay at the foot of Northeast Glacier, off the west coast of Graham Land, Antarctica. It was named for the RMS "Fitzroy", a ship which visited the area in 1947.

5. Fitzroy Dock is a heritage-listed dockyard at the former Cockatoo Island Dockyard, Sydney Harbour, Australia.
